questions.question: 1. What happens to the channel of a P-channel JFET when it is reverse biased?
2. How does the drain current (I_D) in a P-channel JFET respond to an increase in reverse bias voltage (V_GS)?
3. What is the effect of reverse biasing on the gate-source junction of a P-channel JFET?

answers.a: Increases current flow through the gate
answers.b: Decreases current flow through the gate

questions.question: 4. In a P-channel JFET, what occurs when the gate-source voltage (V_GS) is made more positive?
5. What is the pinch-off voltage (V_P) in a P-channel JFET?

answers.a: The voltage at which the channel is fully open
answers.b: The voltage at which the channel is fully closed
answers.c: The voltage at which the drain current starts to increase
answers.d: The voltage at which the gate-source junction becomes forward biased

questions.question: 6. How does the transconductance (g_m) of a P-channel JFET vary with the reverse bias voltage (V_GS)?
7. In the reverse bias condition, what is the primary factor controlling the drain current (I_D) in a P-channel JFET?
8. What is the relationship between the drain current (I_D) and the gate-source voltage (V_GS) in the reverse bias condition for a P-channel JFET?

answers.a: I_D is directly proportional to V_GS
answers.b: I_D is inversely proportional to V_GS
answers.c: I_D is proportional to the square of (V_GS - V_P)
answers.d: I_D is proportional to the exponential of V_GS

questions.question: 9. What is the effect of temperature on the reverse bias characteristics of a P-channel JFET?
10. In a P-channel JFET, when the gate-source voltage (V_GS) is zero, the device operates in which region?
